channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7 micro habits one woman in early menopause used to lose 50 pounds
item.description: After noticing she was gaining weight in early menopause, Michelle Kloese took her health into her own hands to keep the weight off.

item.title: Winter Storm Marches East, Promising a Snowy Weekend for Many
item.description: Another winter storm will rush across the Midwest and the Northeast this weekend, bringing snow and ice along the way.

item.title: Trump Envoy Pushes Lebanon’s New Leaders to Isolate Hezbollah
item.description: Hezbollah, a powerful Iran-backed militia, has long been the country’s dominant political force and has formed part of the government for decades.

item.title: H-1B visa debates roil U.S.-India relations ahead of Trump-Modi meeting. Here’s what needs to change—on both sides
item.description: Can "Made in the USA" and "Make in India" coexist? Protectionist policies from each side are hindering progress.

item.title: Trump Envoy Pushes Lebanon’s New Leaders to Isolate Hezbollah
item.description: Hezbollah, a powerful Iran-backed militia, has long been the country’s dominant political force and has formed part of the government for decades.

item.title: Dozens of Clinical Trials Have Been Frozen in Response to Trump’s USAID Order
item.description: The stop-work order on U.S.A.I.D.-funded research has left thousands of people with experimental drugs and devices in their bodies, with no access to ...

item.title: Anheuser-Busch’s CEO asks for beer brands to be labelled ‘American’ not ‘domestic’
item.description: Brendan Whitworth, U.S. CEO of Anheuser-Busch, wants to make the marketing change in order to reflect the pride of the brand.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil Shortly After Takeoff
item.description: Two people were killed and six were injured by a plane crash in the middle of the street in São Paolo.

item.title: Brooklyn Museum Will Lay Off Employees and Scale Back Exhibitions
item.description: The museum, which faces a projected $10 million deficit, said it planned to cut more than a tenth of its employees and mount fewer exhibitions.

item.title: Trump Lawsuits Against Media Gain Momentum
item.description: First Amendment experts say Mr. Trump’s lawsuits, based on an unproven legal theory, lack merit. But more could be on the way.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: Congo Buries Its Dead After Rebel Assault
item.description: A single image captures the grim task facing those who needed to find space for the dead after a spasm of violence in Central Africa.

item.title: A small Alaska plane carrying 10 people has gone missing. It’s the third major U.S. aviation incident in the last 8 days
item.description: Nome, a Gold Rush town, is known as the ending point of the 1,000-mile Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race.

item.title: Latino bishop says some of his pastors are holding church services with the doors locked because ‘they are scared immigration agents will burst through the door at any moment’
item.description: “I feel so bad and so helpless that I can do nothing more for them," said Bishop Ebli De La Rosa.
